pkg1

Class PlayList

  • java.lang.Object
    • pkg1.PlayList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class PlayList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class is meant as the playlist program It defines a PlayList which stores SongRecord objects in an array of size 50 (maximum value) Its data fields are playlistArray, name, and playlistItems It implements Cloneable because it implements Cloneable
    Version:
    1, July 12, 2016
    Author:
    Jonathan Mathai

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        This method is the equals method for PlayList objects. It goes through each song in the PlayList to see if they are the same and in the same order. If obj is null or it is not a Playlist object, then the return value is false.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the PlayList you want to see whether is equal
        Returns:
        boolean the value of whether the two PlayLists are equal

      • size

        public int size()
        The size method returns how big the PlayList is or how many elements are in the array.

        Determines the number of SongRecords currently in this Playlist. Preconditions: This SongRecord object has been instantiated.

        Returns:
        playlistItems

      • addSong

        public void addSong(SongRecord song,
                    int position)
        The addSong method is used to add a song to the PlayList It will add a song at any position If there is a song at the desired position then it will shift all songs from that position and latter positions to the right. However it will not add a song if the position is not in the playlist or if the playlist is full.

        Preconditions: This SongRecord object has been instantiated and 1 < position < songs_currently_in_playlist + 1. The number of SongRecord objects in this Playlist is less than max_songs.

        Parameters:
        song -
        position -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        FullPlayListException

      • removeSong

        public void removeSong(int position)
        This method is used to remove a song from the PlayList at the desired position The position is the position in the PlayList, not the array It will remove the song at the desired PlayList and then will shift all the songs to the left so that there are no gaps in the playlist

        Preconditions: This SongRecord object has been instantiated and 1 < position < songs_currently_in_playlist. Postcondition: The SongRecord at the desired position in the Playlist has been removed. All SongRecords that were originally in positions greater than or equal to position are moved forward one position. (Ex: If there are 5 songs in a Playlist, positions 1-5, and you remove the SongRecord at position 4, the SongRecord that was at position 5 will be moved to position 4).

        Parameters:
        position -

      • getSong

        public SongRecord getSong(int position)
        This method is used to get a song from a given position in the PlayList similar to the remove method but this is an accessor method

        Preconditions: This Playlist object has been instantiated and 1 < position < songs_currently_in_playlist.

        Parameters:
        position -
        Returns:
        SongRecord

      • getSongsByArtist

        public static PlayList getSongsByArtist(PlayList originalList,
                                        java.lang.String artist)
        This method is used to generate a new playlist the method finds all song objects that have the same artist

        Preconditions: The Playlist referred to by originalList has been instantiated.

        Parameters:
        originalList -
        artist -
        Returns:
        PlayList

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This is the toString method for PlayList It will print out a formatted table of all the songs within the playlist It prints out the artist, title, time and song number in the playlist.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String the formatted table

      • printAllSongs

        public static void printAllSongs(PlayList arr)
        This is the printAllSongs method it is used to print out all the songs in the PlayList It calls the toString method from this class

        Preconditions: This SongRecord object has been instantiated. Postcondition: A neatly formatted table of each SongRecord in the Playlist on its own line with its position number has been displayed to the user.

        Parameters:
        arr -
